revised_title: Experiments on the Lithotriptic Virtue of Carlsbad Waters, Lime-water, and Soap
tldr: The author presents experiments comparing the lithotriptic properties of Carlsbad waters, lime-water, and soap in dissolving calcium. The Carlsbad waters show a much quicker dissolution when the calculi are placed in open vessels, allowing the water to flow constantly along them. The author discusses possible reasons for this difference in lithotriptic power.
